file_content.text: Senator. I'm heading into Voss now. What should I know?
I'm glad you made it here.
I'm still having nightmares about those awful creatures Rogun sent to attack me.
It won't be easy to find out who he's working with here. We barely have diplomatic relations with the Voss.
Start from the beginning. All I remember is something about cyborg attack-beasts and the Force.
Who are these people again?
We know the beasts Rogun uses are Voss species. What we don't know is who helped him implant the cybernetics or ship them off-world.
But it'll be a lot of politics for you to navigate to get that answer.
I'm sure they'll like me.
From what I hear, the Voss are big on propriety and obedience. I don't think you're their type.
I'm hunting Rogun. Don't ask me to play nice.
I'm no diplomat.
One wrong move could impact the whole Republic.
Voss was only discovered a few years ago, and promptly handed the Empire its head when it tried to attack. The Republic's desperate to get them as allies.
What, you don't agree?
You sound skeptical.
Well, I do if we can trust them. The Voss use the Force like no Jedi's ever seen... they'd be powerful allies.
Just tell me who I have to kiss up to.
I'll help any way I can.
The Mystics. Apparently, there's nothing they can't do.
Is there a chance they're siding with the Empire?
The Voss are not an ally?
You wouldn't think so, after the Empire attacked them, but since they were defeated, they've been making nice.
That's the thing--no one really knows the Voss. But they took down an Imperial battle cruiser without breaking a sweat.
And when you ask them, all they say is "the Mystics showed us what must be."
What, the whole planet follows a bunch of quacks?
Mystics? Like fortune tellers?
Don't call them that!
I'd like to meet someone who can show me how to defeat the Empire.
That's a nice trick.
Just tell me what I need to know.
Skip the history.
Follow the rules.
The Mystics are powerful Force users. They have visions of the future, which they use to rule Voss society unquestioned.
And the Voss have made it clear, break one law and the entire Republic can be thrown off this world.
You don't really think you have to warn me about that, do you?
Me? Break rules?
I was almost afraid to say this, in case you took it as a challenge.
I won't take any risks that would hurt the Republic.
I'll be good.
Why do I doubt that?
You have any useful leads on Rogun or his contacts?
How do we find Rogun?
Nothing new, I'm afraid.
I've arranged for a native guide--a diplomat named Lokir-Ka. He'll be waiting in a private room off the shuttle bay.
I sent him files on the beasts that attacked me. I hope he can help you track who sold them.
